title: Senior Product Manager - Platform
description:
Overview
   


 This role focuses on discovering improvements tied to the sportsbook platform in Betsson Group. The role plays a key part in investigating new markets, regulations, and feasibility, to drive informed decisions in SB. The role will also seek to explore opportunities tied to improving the Core Foundation of our SB platform with regards to platform capabilities and performance.
 


  

**Responsibilities** 
  


 • Lead discovery work, conducting in-depth investigations into new market opportunities, regulatory requirements, and feasibility analysis.
   

 • Collaborate with internal sportsbook teams, legal, compliance, and procurement to facilitate smooth market entry.
   

 • Proactively identify evolving requirements in SB in Betsson’s key jurisdictions together with Compliance counterparts.
   

 • Follow the regulatory landscape in Italy specifically for SB, identifying necessary adjustments to maintain compliance.
   

 • Together with value stream PMs & POs help accelerate discoveries related to the Sportsbook platform. E.g. concerning performance demanding topics such as bet placement, settlement and cashout
   

 • Serve as a positive influence and catalyst within the SB product platform, fostering collaboration across the organization.
   

 • Continuously benchmark the SB platform against platform relevant metrics to identify opportunities for improvement.
   

 • Contribute to overall product direction of the SB platform
 


  


  
 


  

**Requirements** 
  


 • Proven experience as a Product Manager within the sportsbook or gaming industry.
   

 • Strong expertise in discovery work, requirements gathering, feasibility analysis with the ability to make relevant trade-offs to balance quality vs effort
   

 • Previous Experience from working on back-end heavy & performance sensitive applications
   

 • Understanding of regulations and compliance, with experience navigating market entry and licensing requirements. Experience working with Italy's gambling regulations is beneficial
   

 • Strong collaboration & communication skills, working effectively with tech teams/architects, commercial stakeholders, and compliance experts.
   

 • Data & Metrics driven ways of working with proven experience to deliver high impact projects with tangible product outcomes.
 


  

**What we offer** 
  

  
* Private & Life Plan Insurance for you and your family
  
* Team Building Budget
  
* Annual Wellness Allowance
  
* Corporate Travel Insurance
  
* Events and initiatives both Local (Quarterly Meetings) and Global
  
* Professional Development Programs & Internal Career Opportunities
  
* Milestone Birthday
  


  


  

 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


  
 


  

 Challenge accepted?
   


***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: Senior Product Manager - Growth
description:
Intro
   

  

 At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.
   

  

 Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation - which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our Customer Retention and Monetisation team at Pleo. In this role, you'll continuously maximize customer value to drive retention, expansion, and long-term growth as we scale our PLG motion. If you're excited about building cutting-edge product-led journeys to unlock tangible value and are passionate about experimentation, customer growth strategies, and the future of Fin-tech, then this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Please note: We are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role in any of the listed locations you find in the job info.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As a Senior Product Manager, you will:
   

  

* Lead initiatives to continuously maximise customer value across trials, upgrades, downgrades, and billing, scaling our PLG motion
* Deeply analyse user behaviour through data (SQL, product analytics, CRM) to identify key cohorts, engagement patterns, and opportunities for growth
* Design and execute experiments to optimise conversion rates for trials, upgrades, and feature adoption
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and Data Science to align on strategies and ensure seamless execution of growth initiatives
* Own the Retention and Monetisation roadmap, translating user insights and business goals into actionable product journeys and feature development
* Iterate on pricing and packaging, working hand in hand with our Pricing expert, exploring new strategies to optimise monetisation
* Conduct qualitative user research (interviews, surveys) to deeply understand user needs and pain points related to product usage and value perception


 What you bring
   

  

 You’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* Strong business acumen with an understanding of SaaS business models, unit economics, and key financial metrics (LTV, churn)
* A results-oriented growth mindset, comfortable with ambiguity and a relentless drive for measurable outcomes through experimentation
* Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, able to articulate complex ideas and influence diverse teams.
* A strong analytical mindset and proficiency in data analysis tools like SQL, Excel, and product analytics platforms (e.g. Amplitude)
* Deep customer empathy and proven experience conducting user research to translate insights into tangible product improvements
* Experience with iterating on pricing and packaging strategies
* Proven product management experience in a Product-Led Growth (PLG) environment, with a solid understanding of the full product development lifecycle


 Who you’ll be working with and reporting to
   

  

 You’ll report to our PLG Director and work closely with teams within PLG, our GTM functions like Marketing, Rev Ops, Sales and CS, as well as closely with other Product teams. Our team of 14 is highly collaborative and dedicated to Product Led Customer Growth. You’ll also have the chance to partner with teams across Data and Pricing to ensure success.
   

  

 How you’ll develop in this role
   

  

 In your first 3 months at Pleo, you’ll:
   

  

* Lead the Retention and Monetisation Strategy creation to drive impact our ambitious customer growth efforts
* Collaborate with Product Marketing, Sales and Pricing to improve our positioning of our paid plans, by launching rapid, hypothesis-driven experiments.
* Grow your skills in your craft, taking on new challenges as the company continues to scale


 We’re committed to helping you develop your career, whether that means taking on bigger projects, stepping into leadership, or acquiring new skills in Product Led Growth.
   

  

 Show me the benefits!
   

  

* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
* Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
* We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
* For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Solutions Consultant
description:
**Job Description:**
 Are you a tech-savvy problem-solver who loves turning big ideas into workable plans and can explain complex tech in plain language? Do you thrive at the intersection of business goals, user experience, and engineering? Then you may be our next Solution Consultant at Merkle!
   

  

 As Solution Consultant, you’ll be part of our Merkle Growth team doing pre-sales efforts and act as a Subject matter expert in our project deliveries.  You’ll guide clients from first conversation to delivery hand-off, shaping solutions that are feasible, scalable, and aligned with business objectives.
   

  

 The position calls for strong analytical thinking, technical experience, clear communication, and a genuine interest in modern content platforms (Sitecore, Optimizely, Adobe, WordPress, and headless stacks) as well as related systems and integrations (e.g. DAM, eCommerce platforms inc. PIM / 3PL integrations, personalization engines to name a few).
   

  

 Your curiosity extends well beyond CMSs – you closely monitor the AI space and have an interest in cloud-native architecture and technological frameworks, always eager to translate them into real-world solutions applicable for our clients.
   

  

 You will work closely with UX/UI designers, developers, project managers, and client directors, data & analysts — all with the aim of creating digital experiences that delight users and drive results.
   

  

**Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include**
* Translating our clients’ business and experience goals into clear technical requirements and roadmaps
* Leading discovery workshops and scoping sessions, breaking work into manageable pieces
* Producing effort estimates, timelines, and high-level architecture diagrams that are relevant to stakeholders can understand
* Acting as a trusted advisor during RFPs and pitches, explaining our proposed approach in a concise, compelling way
* Spotting risks and dependencies early and communicating them clearly to stakeholders
* Acting as a client-facing SME, working with developers and architects to explain to stakeholders how changing requirements impact solution feasibility.
* Staying up to date on technology trends and platform capabilities, integration patterns, and best practices to guide your recommendations


  

  

**For this role, we are looking for someone who has** 
  

  

* 3–6 years of experience as a technical project manager, senior developer, or similar hybrid role
* Experience in an advisory role and stakeholder management is required, ideally from a consultancy, agency, or software company.
* Demonstrated experience in pre-sales activities
* Hands-on experience with at least one modern DXP or CMS (for example Sitecore, Optimizely, Adobe, WordPress, or headless)
* Experience with cloud-based solutions such as AWS, Azure & GCP
* A solid grasp of agile ways of working and related tools (such as JIRA, DevOps, Confluence)
* A track record of turning fuzzy requirements into clear statements of work and estimates
* Experience in presenting to both senior executives and delivery teams, adjusting the level of detail and language as needed
* Fluency in English and Swedish


  

  

**Benefits**
* A great office in Stockholm
* Amazing colleagues who are experts in everything digital
* The flexibility and the best of both worlds – to work from home and the office.
* Excellent career opportunities within both Merkle and Dentsu
* The possibility to work with large, international clients in cross-market teams
* 30 vacation days and 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* Incentives connected to well-being and personal development
* A strong, open culture with several events, after-works, and happenings yearly


  

  

**About Merkle**
 Merkle is a full-service, data-driven customer experience transformation agency. We partner with Top 500 companies in the Northern European region. Our Merkle NE cluster consists of four markets: Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and the Netherlands, and we operate as one unified, leading full-service digital agency to serve our Nordic markets.
   

  

 Our 700+ digital enthusiasts are innovating the way brands are built by providing expertise in Digital Transformation strategy, MarTech platforms, Creativity, UX, CRM, Data, Commerce, and CMS. Merkle is a part of dentsu, a global network of over 66,000 passionate individuals in 146 countries.
   

  

**How to apply** 
  

  

 Click Apply and upload your CV or an updated LinkedIn profile. There is no application deadline; finding the right candidate is more important to us than a speedy process. We remove the job ad when filling the position. If you have any questions, please reach out to our Senior Talent Acquisition Partner, Tine Moe, at tine.moe@merkle.com
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Merkle
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Interim Product Design Lead (16 months)
company_industry: Fashion Accessories Manufacturing and Retail Apparel and Fashion
description:
💙 Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and are eager to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.
 



  





***Interim Product Design Lead* 
 at Sellpy** 




  





**In short, you will** 



* Lead and inspire a team of four skilled UX and UI designers
* Get hands-on by contributing directly to daily design work
* Own and evolve Sellpy’s design system to ensure consistency and an effective way of working
* Mentor and support designers, helping them grow through coaching and guidance
* Improve design processes to increase productivity
* Plan and prioritize design work effectively
* Ensure excellent collaboration and communication between the product design team and the rest of Sellpy—fostering transparency, shared understanding, and effective teamwork across functions
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver seamless, enjoyable and impactful user experiences
* Influence product direction by aligning user and business needs and contributing to strategic planning, roadmaps, and prioritization
* Grow awareness and understanding of design’s impact across the organization
* Recruit future design talent by participating in hiring processes and onboarding new team members



  





**Requirements** 




  





**Education & Experience** 



* 4-5 years of UX design experience in building software products especially customer facing, B2C products like ecommerce
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a love for UX challenges
* Have experience in working with cross-functional teams in iterative product development cycles
* A passion for great leadership and seeing team members grow!
* B.S or M.S. degree in Engineering, Design or a related field
* Written and spoken fluency in English



  





**Skills** 



* Expertise in user-centered design and design thinking methodologies, from problem discovery to solution delivery
* Experience with conducting user research, facilitating ideation, creating prototypes and designs, running user tests, and extracting actionable insights to inform product decisions
* Experience working with Figma (our primary design tool at Sellpy)
* Experience working with design systems
* Understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG 2.2)
* Able to assess the trade-offs between design impact and implementation effort to deliver high-value outcomes efficiently



  





 You bring strong empathy, communication, and collaboration skills, enabling you to lead and work effectively with cross-functional teams. You plan and prioritize design work with a strategic view, guide and inspire others, and foster a positive team culture. As a clear communicator, you advocate for design decisions, bridge the needs of design, development, business, and users. You are a team player with strong leadership skills and have the ability to work without ego. At Sellpy we are all friends and we care for each other.
 



  





**We’d be impressed if you have** 



* Worked in a fast-growing, product-focused startup environment
* Background in re-commerce, e-commerce, or a related digital product domain
* Experience in hiring, scaling and leading a team of designer



  





**You get to** 



* Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges daily
* Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, Rosersberg, and from home
* Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues
* Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform
* Make use of prepaid vacation
* Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more)
* Save up with a monthly pension plan
* Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities



  





**Location** 




 You are welcome to do all these things at our new office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.
 



**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time, temporary
 



**Start:** 
 1st October or 1st November
 



**End:** 
 1st March 2027
 



  





 Ready to make an impact? Send in your application today — we’re excited to hear from you! 💙

title: Business Consultant inom E-Commerce
description:
Älskar du att omvandla data till handling och hjälpa företag utveckla sin E-Handel? Har du ett starkt intresse för kundresor och smarta lösningar? Vi söker en Business Consultant till vårt team – någon som trivs med att arbeta nära kunder och som kan ställa rätt frågor. Om du har förmågan att erbjuda kunder strategiskt stöd och rådgivning samt vägleda dem mot att leverera bättre kundupplevelser, kan du vara den vi söker!
   

  

 Tillsammans med vårt befintliga Customer Experience-team kan vi förse dig med all den data och insikt du kan önska – men det är du som omvandlar den till konkreta och värdeskapande åtgärder för dina kunder.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, proaktiv och kommunikativ. Du trivs i konsultrollen och drivs av att utveckla kundens affär. Du arbetar gärna från vårt kontor, men förstår också vikten av att träffa kunder face-to-face. Du kommer att vara en del av vårt globala CX-team och ha daglig kontakt med kollegor i Danmark, Norge, Sverige, Storbritannien och flera andra länder.
   

  

**För att lyckas i den här rollen bör du ha:**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta analytiskt med verktyg som GA4, Hotjar, GTM, Content Square, Dynamic Yield eller andra verktyg som kan vara relevanta
* En stark förmåga att kommunicera och vägleda kunder – gärna från en tidigare konsultroll
* Erfarenhet av att leda tillväxtinitiativ för e-handelsföretag – antingen i interna roller eller som extern partner.
* Ett praktiskt arbetssätt och en nyfikenhet som driver dig att utforska och testa nya möjligheter


*Please note - for this position,
 **you are required to be fluent in Swedish and English** 
 . We do not offer relocation to Sweden and having a working VISA is a must.*
**Ansökan och nästa steg**
*Vänligen notera att återkoppling kan dröja då rekryteringen är öppen under semestertider. Vi gör vårt bästa för att hantera ansökningarna löpande.*
 Hos oss ansöker du enkelt med din LinkedIn-profil eller CV, utan att behöva fylla i långa frågeformulär. Du behöver inte skicka in något personligt brev.
   

  

 I vår rekryteringsprocess använder vi logik- och personlighetstester. Vi tar alltid referenser och genomför en bakgrundskontroll innan anställning eller erbjudande ges. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Daniel Sparrow. Intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Om Digital Commerce
   

  

**Vilka är vi?** 
 Vi är ett team av duktiga projektledare, utvecklare, arkitekter, UX-designers och affärskonsulter som levererar e-handelsprojekt till våra kunder. Vi arbetar med stora, globala och spännande kunder! Här kan du läsa mer om våra kundprojekt.
   

  

**Varför?** 
 Vi vill hjälpa våra kunder att nå sina affärsmål och göra deras vardag mer effektiv! Målet är att säkerställa deras långsiktiga framgång och guida kunderna genom att vara deras Trusted Advisor. Därför erbjuder vi även underhåll, support och vidareutveckling av deras lösningar. Vi samarbetar med kunderna för att optimera deras system, förbättra prestanda och förebygga incidenter. 💫
   

  

 Jobba på Columbus
   

  

 Columbus är ett företag där värderingar står i centrum, där engagerade medarbetare stöttar varandra genom både toppar och dalar. Vi tror på balans mellan jobb och fritid – oavsett om det handlar om att lämna på förskola eller att ta emot ett paket "någon gång mellan 10 och 19". Hos oss finns tid för återhämtning, och vi arbetar proaktivt med fokus på framtiden. Vi vet också hur man firar framgångar, med allt från fika och lyxiga frukostar till after work på kontoret, och det gör vi gärna ofta! 🥳Stay curious, Build trust, Collaborate, Deliver customer success - Vi vill hävda att våra värdeord gör mer nytta än att bara hänga snyggt på väggen! Dessa vägleder vårt arbete både internt och externt. Genom långsiktiga partnerskap med våra kunder, interna initiativ med Culture
   

  

 Ambassadors, kompetensutveckling inom affärsområdena till högkvalitativa lösningar till våra kunder.
   

  

**Vad andra säger om oss**
 Intresserad av Columbus bakom kulisserna? Varje vecka låter vi en kollega ta över vårt Instagram-konto.
   

  

  

  

 På Careereye kan nuvarande och tidigare medarbetare dela sina
 **ofilterare omdömen om hur det är att arbeta hos oss** 
 . Klicka nedan för att läsa deras upplevelser.

title: SENIOR PRODUCT OWNER APP
description:
**Senior Product Owner App**
 We’re looking for a dedicated Product Owner for App to optimize performance and user experience, driving our mobile platform to its full potential and supporting our digital sales targets. If you're passionate about conversion optimization, personalization, and mobile innovation this role might be the perfect fit for you
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
* Define, prioritize, and manage the initiatives and optimization backlog for app
* Work with internal stakeholders (ancillaries, UX, analytics, content, loyalty, other) and IT to deliver improvements and new functionalities
* Ensure app platform is conversion-optimized, fast, accessible, and scalable
* In collaboration with the Sr. Product Owner for web, own and manage the relationship with our digital experimentation partner (external), driving the A/B testing roadmap and prioritizing experiments. Use test insights to inform and implement high-impact features and UX improvements.
* Incorporate AI features with focus in personalization, into product roadmap
* Ensure seamless and omnichannel experience by working closely with Sr. Product Owner for Web
* Collaborate with the Digital Campaign & Content Managers to ensure that the website is functional and ready during key campaign periods.
* Lead mobile-specific innovations, including push messaging, offline capabilities, and personalization
* KPIs monitoring and analysis


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* 8+ years of experience in product ownership or digital product management, with a strong focus on digital platforms
* Proven track record of driving conversion optimization, user experience improvements, and commercial outcomes in eCommerce environments
* Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., UX/UI, developers, data analysts, marketing) in agile/Lean settings
* Hands-on experience with A/B testing and experimentation frameworks, using data to inform product decisions
* Strong understanding of customer journeys, digital sales funnels, and performance metrics (e.g., CVR, AOV, traffic sources)
* Strong in collaborating with external vendors or tech partners to deliver product improvements
* Experienced in agile ways of working and iterative delivery
* Solid knowledge of Lean and Agile project management methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)
* Proficient in tools such as JIRA, Miro, or similar platforms for project and product management
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal
* Experience working in or with airlines, travel, or other high-transaction-volume industries is a strong plus


 As a person you bring a positive, high-energy attitude with strong teamwork and well-developed soft skills. Takes full ownership of tasks and projects, showing determination and persistence — not accepting “no” as an answer when driving results. Thinks outside the box, consistently seeking creative solutions and workarounds to overcome challenges and deliver on both team and SAS goals.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Other Of Importance**
* Deadline for application: 28/08/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need an EU-work permit. Please note that we ask you to inform us if you currently have a valid EU-work permit.

title: eCom Analytics & Insights Specialist
company_industry: Retail Musical Instruments, Retail Apparel and Fashion, and Retail Appliances, Electrical, and Electronic Equipment
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 




 As an eCom Analytics & Insights Specialist in the Global eCom Experience team, you will work hands-on to transform data into actionable insights that shape our eCom strategy and performance. In this role you will support in making sure we have the right tracking and reports to be able to uncover opportunities and evaluate campaigns as well as reporting on the correct KPIs. You are on top of customers' behavior across site and CRM, notice trend shifts when they happen and are well experiences within CRO and A/B testing. Great communication and interpersonal skills will make you successful in this role. You are reporting to Senior Manager, eCom Experience.
 



**Roles & Responsibilities:** 



* Monitoring the sites and CRM on a daily basis to follow-up on KPIs on both a global and regional level and product category level.
* Continuously monitoring user behaviors and sharing insights with the UX/UI Designer
* Setting plans for CRO and A/B testing and support with evaluations and sharing these with stakeholders
* Creating monthly reports, campaign reports, project evaluations and supporting with quarterly business reviews to follow-up on KPIs
* Managing our eCom Dashboard, report templates, documentations and structures for reporting
* Analyzing and reporting on our CRM data base and helping define segments
* Mentoring the team on how to analyze and follow-up within their area of responsibilities
* Setting up tracking of events in GTM



  





**You probably have the following experiences & skills:** 



* 5+ years experience of similar roles
* Experience in GA4, Looker, Funnel.io, Qlik Sense, PowerBI or similar tools
* Understanding of BigQuery and basic SQL
* Experience analyzing multi-market e-commerce
* Experience of technical implementation of tracking of events and GTM
* Experience with CRO and A/B testing across site and CRM
* Great at creating presentations with clear takeaways and graphs to paint the picture
* Experience from working hands-on with digital/performance marketing and SEO is a plus



  





**Our pledge:** 




 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers. We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
 



**Does this sound like you?** 




 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Är du vår nästa Projektledare inom Digital Commerce?
description:
Är du en Projektledare som vill jobba med att digitalisera våra kunders affärer och följa med i de senaste trenderna? Är du duktig på att bygga långsiktiga relationer och att inspirera våra kunder att växa? Vill du vara en del av ett fantastiskt team och få utrymme till att ta ansvar under stor frihet? Då är du helt rätt för oss!
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

**Vi Hoppar Att Du Har Med Dig Följande**
* Erfarenhet inom agil utveckling
* Gedigen erfarenhet av IT-utvecklingsprojekt
* Erfarenhet av att leda e-handelsprojekt - gärna med ett kommersiellt perspektiv från konsultsidan
* Relevant utbildning är meriterande


*For this position we expect you to be fluent in Swedish and English.*
 Vi söker dig som är självgående, duktig på att få ihop pusslet och skapar trygga långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder. Vår ambition är att alltid vara kundens Trusted Advisor, och delar du den ambitionen med oss är du helt rätt. 🧡
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som projektledare hos oss erbjuds du en spännande arbetsmiljö inom ett expansivt fält där du får arbeta med några av de mest intressanta e-handelsprojekten i Norden. Genom att både dela kunskap, och ta del av kunskap, kommer du att växa som person och vara en viktig del i vårt företag. Våra projektledare kan beskrivas som vår trygga punkt, det är de som håller ordning och visar oss vägen så att vi alla kan trivas i en omväxlande miljö. Du kommer tillhöra till ett team av duktiga projektledare och samarbeta med kompetenta team bestående av utvecklare, arkitekter, UX-designers, affärskonsulter med mera.
   

  

 Kultur
   

  

*"Jag har arbetat som projektledare inom e-handel och digitalisering de senaste tio åren och började på Columbus 2022. Det jag gillar bäst med mitt jobb är möjligheten att samarbeta med skickliga kollegor, arbeta i olika typer av projekt och den internationella arbetsmiljön både på Columbus och kundsidan. Som projektledare kan det ibland vara en stressig miljö, men jag känner att Columbus gör allt för att stödja dessa situationer."*
*Sandra - Projektledare Stockholm*
 Columbus är från början skapat av entreprenörer och den andan lever fortfarande kvar. Vi ligger i framkant, provar nytt och vågar utvecklas in på nya områden. Vi tror att glada och nöjda medarbetare skapar glada och nöjda kunder. Det har gjort att vi är kreativa, lär av varandra och sitter på mycket av branschens kompetens. Vi vill bli bäst på det vi gör, och därifrån ständigt bli bättre. Samtidigt som vi har kul på jobbet, där skratt och skämt är vardag och vi ser fram emot att träffa varandra på måndag morgon 🧡
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär att man kan jobba hemifrån men man förväntas samtidigt vara en del på kontoret och ute hos kund.
   

  

 Ansökningsprocessen
   

  

 Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan. Vi rekryterar löpande. Hos oss kan du ansöka med din LinkedIn-profil eller ditt CV. Som en del av vår process ingår ett logik- och personlighetstest samt en bakgrundskontroll. Kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Daniel Sparrow för frågor.
   

  

*Vänligen notera att återkoppling kan dröja under sommaren men vi gör vårt bästa för att hålla fart i rekryteringen 🌞*
 Om Columbus
   

  

 Vi har i över 30 år erbjudit kunder digitala lösningar, och för att skryta lite – har vi gjort det väldigt framgångsrikt. Vi är stolta över den feedback vi får av våra kunder. På Columbus har vi en omfattande branschkunskap som kombineras med ett stort utbud av digitala lösningar och en rejäl dos kundförståelse. Vår strävan är att bli kundens
 **Trusted Advisor** 
 och vi hjälper och vägleder kunden i alla delar av processen. Vi bygger, implementerar och förvaltar affärslösningar, lägger strategi och inspirerar! Summa summarum, så hjälper vi våra kunder att forma lösningar i toppklass efter branschspecifika behov så att de kan nå sin fulla digitala potential.
   

  

 Columbus är ett värdestyrt bolag med
 **engagerade medarbetare som stöttar varandra i både framgång som motgång** 
 . Att ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid är en självklarhet. Det kan vara allt från hämtning och lämning på förskola till väntan av det där paketet som ska levereras hem ”någon gång mellan 10-19”. Vi lämnar utrymme för återhämtning och ser till att arbeta proaktivt med blicken på horisonten. Dessutom så är vi riktigt bra på att fira framgångar och det är inte ovanligt med fika, lyxfrukost och AW på kontoret 🥳
   

  

 Vi lever efter våra värdeord –
 **Stay Curious, Build Trust, Collaborate och Deliver Customer Success 🏆️**
 Jobba på Columbus
   

  

 Spana in vårt Insta-flöde för att få en bild av
 **hur det är att jobba hos oss** 
 genom våra kollegor. Klicka på bilden för att komma till Instagram-kontot.
   

  

  

  

**Helt ofiltrerat** 
 har vi samlat in omdömen från nuvarande och tidigare kollegor. Klicka nedan för att läsa mer.

title: Product Manager – PV and Battery Solutions
description:
**About Aira**
 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are building a pioneering team to shape the future of residential energy. As Product Manager – PV and Battery Solutions, you will take end-to-end ownership of our power products, with a clear focus on commercial impact, customer experience, and strategic market fit. This is a highly cross-functional role that sits at the intersection of product strategy, technology innovation and business development.
   

  

 Your mission will be to define and deliver a compelling offering within our integrated home energy ecosystem. You will coordinate the roadmap activities from initial concept to launch, as well as ongoing in-life management, driving growth through customer insight, strategic partnerships, and strong execution.
   

  

 This is a senior role that requires both strategic thinking and operational excellence. You’ll work closely with hardware and software engineering, UX, marketing, and local market teams—while also engaging external technology partners and vendors to ensure we deliver a differentiated and scalable offering to our customers.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Define and lead the vision, strategy, and high-level roadmap for our power product portfolio, with a strong emphasis on commercial opportunity and competitive positioning
* Orchestrate the end-to-end product lifecycle: from market analysis and concept validation to product development, launch, and optimization
* Translate customer, market, and regulatory insights into product requirements that balance commercial goals with technical feasibility
* Develop product requirements and specifications and work closely with hardware and software engineering, design, and program management teams to ensure product requirements are met
* Partner with go-to-market teams to develop value proposition and ensure successful product launches, positioning, and channel readiness across markets
* Serve as the internal advocate and evangelist for our power product offering, ensuring alignment, enthusiasm, and clear communication across teams to drive product success
* Lead in-life product management by tracking performance, gathering customer feedback, and driving continuous improvements
* Collaborate with external partners and suppliers to strengthen our product portfolio and drive innovation and speed
* Own business case development and work closely with relevant stakeholders on pricing, and profitability models, ensuring commercial success of the solar & battery product line
* Act as a senior stakeholder in the broader energy product portfolio strategy, aligning roadmaps and opportunities across product lines


**What We’d Like You To Have**
* 5+ years of experience in product management or product leadership roles for consumer hardware solutions
* Proven success bringing complex products to a global or pan european market
* Strong commercial acumen and experience making data-driven decisions to drive business outcomes
* Experience working with combined hardware and customer centric software development
* Track record of collaborating with both internal stakeholders and external technology or manufacturing partners
* Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills
* Experience working cross-functionally in fast-paced, high-growth environments
* Demonstrated ability to balance long-term strategic thinking with hands-on delivery
* Familiarity with grid-tied energy systems and residential solar installations
* Experience working at a fast-growing scale-ups


**What’s in it for you?**
 At Aira, you’ll gain hands-on experience in a supportive and inclusive culture where career growth is encouraged and celebrated. You’ll collaborate with diverse, international teams and help launch products that make a real difference globally.
   

  

 Working in our entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment, you’ll have the opportunity to grow both personally and professionally—developing your skills while contributing to something meaningful. You’ll thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture where challenges are seen as opportunities and your ideas can shape the future.
   

  

 Your work will have a visible impact—not only on the success of our products and markets, but also on the journey toward a more sustainable world.
   

  

 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.
   

  

 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual.
   

  

 We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.

title: E-commerce Director
description:
Nordic Knots is looking for an E-Commerce Director to join our growing team in Stockholm. This is a key leadership role for someone who wants to drive the performance of our online business, helping to accelerate growth across both our DTC and Trade channels.
 



  





 We’re building a company around thoughtful and long-lasting design, strong relationships, and great customer experiences. As E-Commerce Director, you’ll help us deliver on that promise—ensuring our website not only reflects our brand but also performs as a best-in-class digital storefront.
 



  





**About the role** 




 Reporting to the Chief Growth Officer, you’ll lead the global e-commerce strategy for Nordic Knots, with responsibility for revenue performance, site experience, merchandising, and conversion. This role blends commercial acumen with a sharp eye for digital UX, combining business goals with customer-centric execution.
 



  





 You’ll oversee the full e-commerce funnel—from landing experience to checkout—working closely with growth, CRM, tech, and creative teams to build and optimise a seamless shopping journey. You’ll also lead a small but growing e-commerce team, helping to shape the function as we scale.
 



  





 As we continue to expand into new markets and product categories, you’ll play a critical role in aligning digital strategy with company-wide growth goals, ensuring our online experience supports both inspiration and conversion.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Responsible for e-commerce performance across DTC and Trade
* Lead the site merchandising, UX, and CRO strategy
* Oversee day-to-day site operations and ensure product launches, promotions, and content updates run smoothly
* Partner with tech and design teams to improve site architecture, navigation, and customer journey
* Use analytics and customer insights to drive conversion and retention improvements
* Collaborate closely with marketing, CRM, and creative teams to align digital storytelling with business goals
* Lead and develop the e-commerce team, ensuring clear focus and accountability
* Help define our omnichannel strategy as we expand into physical retail and new digital experiences



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* 6+ years of experience in e-commerce, ideally in a DTC brand or high-growth retail environment
* A mix of strategic thinking and operational know-how—you can zoom out and lead, but also roll up your sleeves
* Strong understanding of UX, analytics, and conversion optimisation
* Experience working with cross-functional teams including tech, design, growth, and logistics
* Proven ability to manage and improve an e-commerce P&L
* Experience with merchandising and content planning across global markets
* Comfortable using analytics tools to guide decisions (GA4, Looker, etc.)
* Fluent in English



  





**About Nordic Knots** 




 Nordic Knots was founded in 2016 by Liza Berglund Laserow, Fabian Berglund, and Felix Berglund. We are a fast-growing direct-to-consumer Scandinavian interior design brand. The USA is our largest market, followed by the UK and EU.
 



 Nordic Knots was born from a culture of thoughtful design that lasts beyond seasons and trends. Fusing function and aesthetics with a Scandinavian sensibility, we craft timeless textiles for the modern home. We believe great textiles are foundational—they can transform a house into a harmonious home, framing the most beautifully curated lives.
 



 Our head office is located in Stockholm at our flagship store on Birger Jarlsgatan. In 2024, we opened our first flagship store in New York City. We have a growing team in both Stockholm and New York and are expanding our presence in the UK and EU.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 We are a fun and driven team with high ambitions. We have an entrepreneurial and open-minded culture where all new ideas and suggestions for improvements are valued and encouraged. At Nordic Knots everyone should feel that they are a part of and contributing towards our success as we continue to scale up.
 



  





 At Nordic Knots we stand for a diverse and inclusive workforce. We seek talented individuals who bring a range of perspectives and inspired ideas. We welcome all applicants eager to join a dynamic team.
 



  





**Location** 




 This is a Stockholm-based role.
 



 Please apply with your CV and cover letter in English.

title: Lead Game Designer - Games
description:
We are looking for a talented and experienced Lead Game Designer to join THE FINALS game team here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering around ~100 developers.
   

  

 As a Lead Game Designer at Embark, you will be responsible for detailed design work on the project, as well as instigating and reviewing the designs of other designers. You will collaborate closely with the directors of the project, in refining concepts and ideas into tangible designs, prototypes and features, as well as working with Production leadership in helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

 We would like you to take on managerial responsibilities for some of the projects’ Design staff, as well as coach and mentor the projects Game Designers in design methodology and documentation practices. And inspire them to deliver high quality, balanced and scalable systems and player experiences, fitting for Live Service and Free-to-play PvP Action Games.
   

  

 You will also own and spearhead game features directly, and work hands-on in cross disciplinary teams while implementing gameplay features
   

  

**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind.
* 10+ years of experience designing and making games and a proven track record with multiple shipped titles.
* An excellent grasp of AAA PvP gameplay and systems design, including knowledge of player psychology, UX design, gameplay mechanics and dynamics.
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience with Blueprints and scripting.
* Able to adapt to varied learning and communication styles of team members and stakeholders.
* A good knowledge and familiarity with the various game maker disciplines, coding, animation, game physics, 3D Art, etc.
* Enjoyment of creative collaboration in cross disciplinary groups.
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Business Analyst - PDM System Team, TRATON Group R&D
description:
**Do you love software development and want to create real business value?**
 At TRATON, you will help drive our unique modular system delivering a wide product range with minimal complexity. If you are excited by dynamic challenges and want to grow fast, keep reading.
   

  

 Our Value Creation Team (VCT) is hiring a curious
 **Business Analyst** 
 to work with our powerful in-house Product Data Management system (PDM).
   

  

 TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation – let’s make a difference together.
   

  

 Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values –
 **customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste** 
 – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 This role is part of TRATON Group R&D, located in Södertälje, Sweden.
   

  

 We are looking for a curious and driven Business Analyst to join our Value Creation Team (VCT). You will work with our in-house Product Data Management system (OAS), helping to drive TRATON’s modular product strategy. This is a great opportunity to contribute to a unique PLM solution and collaborate with stakeholders across the TRATON Group.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Explore and analyze business and customer needs to identify requirements and drive process improvements.
* Break down complex requirements and collaborate with stakeholders, architects, developers, testers, and UX specialists.
* Ensure solutions deliver value by aligning with business goals and guiding users through acceptance testing.
* Continuously improve ways of working to strengthen the team and domain.
* Contribute to strategic TRATON initiatives across Sweden, Germany, the US, China, and Latin America.


**Who You Are**
 You enjoy working in a diverse, agile team with a strong customer and user focus. You value collaboration, stay flexible in changing environments, and contribute to a positive atmosphere while delivering continuously.
   

  

 We believe you will succeed in this role if you:
   

  

  

* Hold a degree in IT, business management, or a related field.
* Have 5+ years of experience in business analysis, ideally within Product Data Management or service-related areas.
* Are skilled in process and information modelling, and documenting system functionality.
* Have experience with product structures, change management, and product description methodologies.
* Communicate fluently in English; Swedish and/or German is a plus.
* Are eager to learn and adapt to new technical environments, even if you haven’t worked with PLM/PDM systems before.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives are valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 You will join the Value Creation Team (VCT), a Lean-Agile team inspired by SAFe, with around 100 colleagues including Product Owners, Business Analysts, Architects, Developers, and Testers. You’ll work closely with Group R&D Vehicle Service Information and be supported by a dedicated onboarding buddy. Our team values transparency, integrity, flexibility, and empathy.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry.
   

  

**TRATON Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than
 **2025-08-25** 
 . Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Philipp Lindemann, Unit Manager PDM Processes & Systems, +46 7 214 526 11
   

  

 If this sounds like a role where you would thrive, do not hesitate to apply, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D.

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 3 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Space Software Engineer
description:
**Company Overview:**  

Rapidity Space is a leading space engineering services provider based in Uppsala, Sweden dedicated to pushing the boundaries of space exploration and innovation. Our team is made up of experts in various fields including software engineering, electrical engineering, aerospace engineering, and more. We are seeking a talented and passionate software engineer to join our team of dedicated professionals who share our passion for space technology. With 100% focus on space, our goal is to facilitate and expedite our customers’ and partners’ development projects and business opportunities to make them thrive in an ever-so-exciting industry environment.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

As a Software Engineer at Rapidity Space, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and testing software solutions for our clients in the satellite and space systems industry. You will work collaboratively with other engineers and scientists to understand and analyse the requirements of the system and develop high-quality software that meets those requirements.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Design, develop, and test software solutions for satellite and space systems.
* Collaborate with other engineers and scientists to understand system requirements.
* Write high-quality code and documentation.
* Test and debug software to ensure high-quality and reliable systems.
* Provide technical support for software-related issues during system integration and testing.
* Stay up-to-date with new technologies and industry trends.
* Contribute to the development of software engineering best practices within the company.


**Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or another relevant and related field
* Relevant experience in software engineering
* Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as C++, C, and Python
* Experience with software development tools such as Git, JIRA, and Agile methodologies
* Understanding of software development processes, including design, coding, testing, and debugging.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively while developing correct and robust software.


**Useful skills:**  

* Experience in developing software for Real-time systems, including working with RTOS (RTEMS).
* Expertise in Space systems engineering, including knowledge of the space environment and constraints that impact software design and development.
* Modern C++, i.e. C++11/17/20.
* Strong skills in Requirements engineering, including the ability to understand and translate system-level requirements into software requirements.
* Proficiency in driver development, including experience with device drivers for custom hardware components.
* Experience in FPGA development, including knowledge of hardware description languages (HDLs) such as VHDL or Verilog.
* Digital electronics development/troubleshooting, including knowledge of electronic circuits and components.
* Familiarity with CMake build system, including the ability to write and maintain CMake files for complex software projects.
* Experience with unit testing frameworks such as GTest, including the ability to write and run automated tests for software components.
* Proficiency in continuous integration tools such as Jenkins, including the ability to set up and maintain automated build and test pipelines.
* Expertise in serial communication protocols such as UART, bus protocols such as CAN bus, and network protocols such as SpaceWire.
* Knowledge of Extreme Programming (XP) methodologies, including the ability to work in an agile software development environment.
* Experience with open-source contributions and hobby projects, including a passion for learning and staying up-to-date with new technologies and trends in software.


**Finally:**  

With Rapidity Space you get the opportunity to apply your experience and expertise on challenging engineering tasks with the final goal of letting ingenious solutions loose in the ever-expanding environment of space.

title: Data Engineer
description:
### **OM JOBBET**


Vill du arbeta med avancerad teknik inom datautveckling och bidra till samhällsnytta på riktigt? Vi söker nu en erfaren dbt-utvecklare till en myndighet med högt säkerhetstänk och komplexa datamiljöer. Här får du möjlighet att vara en nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av robusta, återanvändbara och standardiserade datalösningar som gör skillnad för hela Sverige.


I rollen kommer du att arbeta i en hybrid analysmiljö med moderna data lakehouse-strukturer, där du får kombinera din tekniska kompetens inom SQL, Python och CI/CD med en djup förståelse för datamodellering och automatisering. Du kommer vara med och utveckla, optimera och underhålla dbt-modeller, templates och makron, bygga pipelines och integrera lösningar som håller högsta kvalitet.

### **OM FÖRETAGET**


Vår uppdragsgivare är en samhällsviktig organisation med ett nationellt ansvar och ett uppdrag som påverkar många människors vardag. Här hanteras och analyseras komplexa datamängder som ligger till grund för viktiga beslut och långsiktig planering. Arbetsmiljön präglas av säkerhet, noggrannhet och teknisk spetskompetens, kombinerat med starkt samarbete och kontinuerlig utveckling.

### **ARBETSUPPGIFTER**


Utveckla och underhålla dbt-modeller, templates och makron för hög återanvändbarhet  

* 

Arbeta med avancerad datamodellering och SQL i komplexa miljöer  
* 

Bygga och förvalta CI/CD-pipelines och kodflöden  
* 

Utveckla i Python och arbeta med moderna data lakehouse-strukturer  
* 

Konfigurera Docker-containrar och arbeta med hybrida analysplattformar  
* 

Bidra med orkestreringslösningar i Airflow, Dagster eller liknande verktyg  
* 
* Delta i agilt utvecklingsarbete och bidra till förbättring av processer och metoder

### **ERFARENHETER OCH EGENSKAPER**


 Vi söker dig som:

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av SQL och datamodellering
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet av dbt-utveckling, Python-programmering och arbete med moderna data lakehouse-strukturer
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet av CI/CD och kodpipelines
* Har minst 1 års erfarenhet av arbete med Docker-containrar och dbt mot relationsdatabaser
* Har erfarenhet av hybrida analysplattformar och att skapa/underhålla dbt-templates och makron
* Har akademisk utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kompetens
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska
* Kan genomgå och godkännas i säkerhetsprövning


Meriterande erfarenheter:

* Har arbetat inom myndighet eller säkerhetskritisk miljö
* Har erfarenhet av dbt core i on-prem-miljöer
* Har erfarenhet av orkestrering med Airflow, Dagster eller liknande verktyg
* Har erfarenhet av automatiserade tester
* Har arbetat agilt, gärna enligt SAFe

### **ÖVRIGT**

**Plats:** Stockholm, med hybridmöjlighet  

**Start:** Omgående  

**Omfattning:** Heltid

### **OM D-SOURCE**

*Your source to IT*  

D-Source är ett modernt konsultbolag med bredden mellan helpdesk, infrastruktur och Tech. Vi har lång erfarenhet av att förstå kunders IT-behov! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du är intresserad av att ta reda på mer.


Vad kan vi göra för dig och vad kan vi göra tillsammans?  



  

### **INGET JOBB FÖR DIG?**


Lugnt! Du kan alltid registrera dig förutsättningslöst på D-Source jobbsida genom att Connecta med oss. Då hamnar du i vår kandidatdatabas och får koll på våra kommande aktuella tjänster.

title: Teamchef Privat IT Utveckling
description:
*Är du en coachande och kommunikativ ledare med erfarenhet av agil utveckling? Vill du vara en drivande kraft i Länsförsäkringars digitala transformation och bidra till att bygga starka och stabila team? Vi söker nu fyra teamchefer för IT-utveckling inom AE SAK – IT och Utvecklingsstyrning. Områdena omfattar Företag, Motor och Privat. Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Läs vidare och ansök idag!*  


**Om jobbet**Som Teamchef IT-utveckling får du en central roll i att leda och utveckla agila team som arbetar med att utveckla och förvalta IT-stödet inom sakförsäkringsaffären. Du ansvarar för att bygga långsiktig kompetens och skapa stabila team, med fokus på att attrahera, anställa och behålla egen personal.  


Rollen innebär att du arbetar nära andra teamchefer, RTE:er och ledningsgruppen för IT-utveckling för att stärka organisationens systemutvecklingsförmåga. Du bidrar till att utveckla vår interna kompetens inom systemutveckling och säkerställer att vi har rätt mix av medarbetare och externa resurser för att möta verksamhetens behov.  


Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
* Leda och coacha medarbetare med ett coachande ledarskap som utgår från lean-agila principer.
* Bygga, leda och utveckla team med fokus på långsiktig kompetensutveckling.
* Säkerställa rätt bemanning och kompetensförsörjning i teamen.
* Samarbeta med andra chefer och RTE:er för att driva utvecklingen framåt.
* Bidra till operativ leverantörsstyrning och effektiv resursanvändning.
  


**Vem är du?**Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
* Erfarenhet av coachande ledarskap, gärna som chef, projektledare, RTE eller Scrum Master.
* Flerårig erfarenhet av IT-utveckling och god förståelse för systemutvecklingens processer.
* Förmåga att rekrytera, leda och utveckla utvecklare och systemspecialister.
* Stark förståelse för IT, arkitektur och agilt ledarskap.
* Erfarenhet av att planera och genomföra utvecklingsaktiviteter mot uppsatta mål.
* Akademisk examen inom IT, exempelvis systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  


Meriterande är även om du har:
* Erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning och bemanning i miljöer med outsourcade resurser.
* Erfarenhet av budgetarbete och rapportering.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som utvecklare i början av din karriär.
  


Som person är du resultatorienterad och har en stark förmåga att inspirera och engagera andra. Du är modig, strukturerad och har hög integritet, vilket gör att du kan utmana och driva förändring på alla nivåer i organisationen. Du är en lagspelare som trivs med att samarbeta, samtidigt som du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt och driva arbetet framåt. Med din lyhördhet och förmåga att bygga sammanhållning skapar du en trygg och motiverande arbetsmiljö för dina team.  


**Om oss**Vi välkomnar dig till avdelningen IT och Utvecklingsstyrning på affärsenhet Sak. Här arbetar vi med en spännande utvecklingsagenda och har en hög ambition att fortsätta vår lean-agila resa. Utvecklingen av IT-stödet inom sakförsäkringsaffären är central för Länsförsäkringsgruppens framgång, och vi är ett engagerat team som trivs tillsammans, stöttar varandra och har kul på jobbet.  


Vårt ledarskap präglas av tillit och vi strävar efter att skapa en kultur med hög psykologisk trygghet. Hos oss får du verka i en miljö med starkt driv och högt engagemang, där kunden och medarbetaren alltid står i centrum. Samtidigt värnar vi om en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv.  


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*

OBS: då vi är inne i semestertider kan återkoppling dröja lite längre än vanligt.  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2025-08-29**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Helen Kramer
**Kontaktuppgifter:** Helen.Kramer@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.
